column4: how easy is it to record satellite tv onto an ubuntu machine?
assuming you're using a sat tv card, that is
unsure... i'd guess about 70, but maybe less
check out linuxtv.org for linux compatibility of TV cards
there used to be all-in-one graphics+tv cards, but yeah, right now they're mostly separate PCI cards or USB cards
at least, the terrestrial tv ones are very popular on USB as well, maybe for sat PCI is the only real choice
are you in europe or in the US? i mentioned DVB, but i'm not sure if US satellites use DVB-S as well as the one we point to in europe (though i think they do)
do you have something similar setup
not really, but since i recently bought a (crappy) DVB-T (i.e. terrestrial digital) USB card, i informed myself a little
i payed the terrestrial card 29, for the record. though i suppose satellite cards are a bit more specialized... given my (not very good) experience, though, i wouldn't aim to the *very* budget ones
out of curiosity, where do you live?
what sort of connectors am i gonna need from satellite box to tv card?
just the normal antenna cable, i think...
peep at Hauppage's site, i think their cards are on average the ones best supported on Ubuntu (i'm thinking mostly of terrestrial TV, but i suppose they've got satellite too)
